docTitle.titlePart: Broadband towed marine seismic via total source and receiver de-ghosting

front.div:
ABSTRACT
Conventional towed streamer seismic acquisition
suffers from the ghost recording at the receiver as a
direct consequence of towing the streamer beneath the
sea surface.
Energy reflected from the earth's
subsurface is recorded in the streamer sensors first as
an up-going wave-front, then secondly as a down-
going reflection from the sea surface. This reflection
from the sea surface is referred to as the 'ghost'
recording. The ghost adversely affects the seismic
record, introducing notches in the frequency spectrum.
